modules.description: This module enforces constraints through functions like validating string formats against regex patterns (UUIDs, IPs, emails), checking value ranges, and ensuring structural integrity of lists and options. It operates on strings, generic types, and structured data, returning rich error types that identify specific validation failures with contextual codes. Common applications include sanitizing user input, verifying API request payloads, and maintaining data consistency in distributed systems.

This module processes type declarations to generate validation functions for OCaml data structures. It transforms type definitions into value bindings and signature items, and determines recursion in types. It is used to automatically derive validation logic for algebraic data types in both implementations and interfaces.
